Articles.Content: Lol true but it would be good for all groups involved to get popularity up. I have attempted to recruit some friends into KSP and they talk about how cool contests would be.

A fair point it nearly happened with Arcadia loyalties were split 50-50.Teamwork would play out nicely although complicated.

Edited November 4, 2013 by Spartwo

The 144th responded, like they always do, to this threat, and arrive with a two-ship advance force. Tiger and Jaguar are both Drekevak 15-2s, 50-ton light destroyers designed to screen the Heavy Dreks.

Then came the Big Boys. Their formation was Child of Darkness, Newcastle, and Riley

The oldest-Child of Darkness- Has two confirmed kills and a Zokesian Gold Star (excellence in combat). Initially a test ship of the 40-sepratron "death halo" missiles, she was refitted for the Second Genesis war, and then was refitted again to XIV-LAV standards after receiving damage during the battle.

Newcastle is the newest, being commissioned just days before out of the hull of Stonewall, knocked out during the Tegu Incident.

Riley has one confirmed kill, and received a commendation for killing the Bismark in the Tegu Incident. She is scheduled for decommission because of frame warp received when dumb firing her LAV-PM at Bismark, due to a hiccup in the Missile Exhaust Exchanger system (which was still being perfected at the time of the incident).

The 144th responded, like they always do, to this threat, and arrive with a two-ship advance force. Tiger and Jaguar are both Drekevak 15-2s, 50-ton light destroyers designed to screen the Heavy Dreks.

Then came the Big Boys. Their formation was Child of Darkness, Newcastle, and Riley

The oldest-Child of Darkness- Has two confirmed kills and a Zokesian Gold Star (excellence in combat). Initially a test ship of the 40-sepratron "death halo" missiles, she was refitted for the Second Genesis war, and then was refitted again to XIV-LAV standards after receiving damage during the battle.

Newcastle is the newest, being commissioned just days before out of the hull of Stonewall, knocked out during the Tegu Incident.

Riley has one confirmed kill, and received a commendation for killing the Bismark in the Tegu Incident. She is scheduled for decommission because of frame warp received when dumb firing her LAV-PM at Bismark, due to a hiccup in the Missile Exhaust Exchanger system (which was still being perfected at the time of the incident).

Um Zekes could you resetup? the way you have your ships the physics doesn't like it and i sent a missile through all three. Just one and I don't even think i actually hit the other two. Killing all three Dreks. Also putting your ships as close together as possible so that it makes it harder for me to hit you does not work with my computer that well. Its a beast.

Smart putting your ships that far out pinning me between you and the planet. Id have to leave planetary orbit to use my delta V advantage.

It was a good clean kill on one but the other two are a glitch.
